    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts a Server-application.

      • run

        public void run()
        Listens to a port of this Server if there are any Clients that would like to connect. For every new socket connection a new ClientHandler thread is started that takes care of the further communication with the Client.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • identify

        public void identify(ClientHandler c)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.

        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.

      • getCheckChallenger

        public java.lang.String getCheckChallenger()
        Returns:
        the name of the client that has sent the challenge request.

      • setCheckChallenger

        public void setCheckChallenger(java.lang.String challenger)
        Parameters:
        challenger - the name of the client that has sent the challenge request.

      • challenge

        public void challenge(ClientHandler c,
             java.lang.String challenged)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
        challenged - the name of the client that has been challenged by another client.

      • challengeDecline

        public void challengeDecline(ClientHandler c,
                    java.lang.String challenger)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
        challenger - the name of the client that has sent the challenge request.

      • challengeAccept

        public void challengeAccept(ClientHandler c,
                   java.lang.String challenger)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
        challenger - the name of the client that has sent the challenge request and to whom the challengeAccept command should be sent.

      • queue

        public void queue(ClientHandler c,
         java.lang.String message)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
        message - the command that is sent by the clientHandler c.

        Parameters:

      • movePut

        public void movePut(ClientHandler c,
           java.lang.String[] blocks)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
        blocks - an array of the command that was sent by the clientHandler c split by a msgSeparator.

      • moveTrade

        public void moveTrade(ClientHandler c,
             java.lang.String[] tiles)
        Parameters:
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
        tiles - an array of the command that was sent by the clientHandler c split by a msgSeparator.

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(java.lang.String msg,
             ClientHandler c)
        Parameters:
        msg - the message that was sent by the clientHandler c.
        c - the clientHandler which has to be used in the method since it has sent the command.
